title: RS20737
content: U.S. economic assistance to the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (FRY) seeks to fosterdemocratic institutions andeconomic reform. Congress approved $100 million for Serbia for FY2001 and the Administration has requested$145 million for the FRY for FY2002. Congressional debate may center on constraints on that aid, the role of other donors, and Serbia's relationship withMontenegro and Kosovo in that context.
